title: Rational and Polynomial Functions - Characteristics - Part B

content.description: The polynomial functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49E0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4362@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, respectively. The rational function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> is defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4313@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question:
Part B

In the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadIhacaWG5baaaa@3844@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane, the graph of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> has a hole at the point with coordinates <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaacIcacaWGJbGaaiilaiaadYeacaGGPaaaaa@3A0B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. It is known that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>c</mi> </mrow> </munder> <mtext> </mtext><mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>L</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42EA@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and that there are consecutive integers <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>b</mi> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>L</mi><mo><</mo><mi>b</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadggacqGH8aapcaWGmbGaeyipaWJaamOyaaaa@3AEF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What are the values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>b</mi> </math> ? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text:
Part B

In the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadIhacaWG5baaaa@3844@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane, the graph of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> has a hole at the point with coordinates <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaacIcacaWGJbGaaiilaiaadYeacaGGPaaaaa@3A0B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. It is known that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>c</mi> </mrow> </munder> <mtext> </mtext><mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>L</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42EA@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and that there are consecutive integers <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>b</mi> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>L</mi><mo><</mo><mi>b</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadggacqGH8aapcaWGmbGaeyipaWJaamOyaaaa@3AEF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What are the values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>b</mi> </math> ? Give a reason for your answer.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
